Package com.jimmyselectronics.opeechee

Class CardReader

java.lang.Object
com.jimmyselectronics.AbstractDevice<CardReaderListener>
com.jimmyselectronics.opeechee.CardReader
public class CardReader extends AbstractDevice<CardReaderListener>
Represents the card reader, capable of tap, chip insert, and swipe. Either the reader or the card may fail, or the data read in can be corrupted, with varying probabilities.
Author:
Jimmy's Electronics LLP

      public CardReader()

  • Method Details

    • tap

      public Card.CardData tap(Card card) throws IOException
      Tap the card. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to tap.
      Returns:
      The card's (possibly corrupted) data, or null if the card is not tap enabled.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the tap failed (lack of failure does not mean that the data is not corrupted).

    • swipe

      public Card.CardData swipe(Card card) throws IOException
      Swipe the card. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to swipe.
      Returns:
      The card data.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the swipe failed.

    • insert

      public Card.CardData insert(Card card, String pin) throws IOException
      Insert the card. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      card - The card to insert.
      pin - The customer's PIN.
      Returns:
      The card data.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If there is already a card in the slot.
      IOException - The insertion failed.

    • remove

      public void remove()
      Remove the card from the slot. Requires power.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - if no card is present.
